reviews.text: The room was nicely decorated, the bed was comfortable but the shower was amazing. The staff were very accommodating and whilst having breakfast, one member of staff brought out cake as she found out it was my birthday! The breakfast was always divine and the staff made the experience staying in this hotel truly memorable.

A Stylish Stay in the Heart of London
Gem Fitzrovia Hotel offers a sophisticated blend of traditional elegance and modern comfort. Nestled in the vibrant Fitzrovia neighborhood, this 4-star hotel provides a convenient base for exploring London's West End.
The hotel's rooms are beautifully appointed with classic furnishings and modern amenities, ensuring a relaxing stay. Guests can enjoy a delicious continental and English breakfast each morning, setting them up for a day of sightseeing or business.
For a more leisurely experience, unwind in the hotel's stylish lounge bar, which offers a cozy atmosphere and a selection of beverages and light snacks.
With its prime location, Gem Fitzrovia Hotel is within walking distance of popular attractions such as Regent's Park, Oxford Street, and Soho. The nearby Portland Place tube station provides easy access to other parts of London.
Whether you're visiting for leisure or business, Gem Fitzrovia Hotel offers a comfortable and stylish accommodation option in the heart of London.

Location was perfect just minutes walk from Greatportland station. Clean rooms and lobby area. We stayed for 6 nights staff was always available to help. Beds are small but comfortable with clean bedding. Small groceries store near and plenty of restaurants, coffee shops and pubs. We will definitely stay here next time we travel to London.

Room was 15C when I got there. Bed has no nightstands. Front desk staff not knowledgeable or friendly. Did not greet me. Advertised as having a bar. Looked like a bank teller window. No bartender, no mixed drinks. Glass partition. Nobody speaks English. Way too expensive. Never again.

IT was my secod stay, this time room was a lot more spacious and quiet. Food also was better quality. Location is very good, round the corner from my client's office and within walking distance to Oxford street.
